Forward Programme 2013-2014

01 September, 2014 | Graham Welsby

The aim of this programme, is to give members a varied range of aspects and techniques. Consisting of Focus Points, that are more discussions, and workshops where you should bring your cameras along to give it a go.



Workshops / Focus Points.


  • 31st September 2013

Recourses – Why / Where / How… We will be looking on how to utilise YouTube as a valuable educational recourse.

  • 28th October 2013

Macro – This month we will be covering the world of macro photography. Small close ups, small insects etc. The equipment, technique etc…

  • 25th November 2013

Through the Lens – F stops, numbers, zoom, prime, what does it all mean? Which one is for you? What do they all do?

  • 27th January 2014

Judging – During this focus point, we will be discussing what to look for when judging the BCC’s competitions. The rules and examples of what they mean.

  • 24th February 2014

Whats in your bag? – What do you carry with you in your camera bag? Is it a lens wipe, spare batteries, a million lenses, just memory cards? Open forum tonight again to discuss simple ideas that may help others learn about very simple equipment that can make a big difference. Remember that piece of A4 white paper…

  • 31st March 2014

Exposure – Something we have covered before, but looking to refresh your memory and go into some more advanced settings.

  • 28th April 2014

Wildlife – This will be talking all about wildlife photography, what to look for, tips and tricks to getting those moments.

  • 26th May 2014

Manipulation – This is outside the usual competition ruling. But it is a skill that is useful for your personal projects. Simple cloning, touching up techniques… if you have specific questions or images you would like worked on, please email them prior to the meeting and we will see what we can do.

  • 30th June 2014

Model Night – Following on from the popular lighting night, we are hopefully getting in our model again, and going through some tips to getting a good pose. How to interact to get the best out of your subject.

  • 24th July 2015

TBA – This all depends on what comes out of the Open Forums, and will be decided through the year.
